title: When my email address is prompted, it includes a corrupted one

creator: Sebastian42

title: "Manage bookmarks" always opens at "other bookmarks" (which is empty).
content:
Hi, Folks. When I open "manage bookmarks" (Library), why does it always open at "other bookmarks"? This is at the very bottom of the alphabetical list (and empty) so I always have to scroll back up to the top. I've got a lot of bookmarks, so this is extremely irritating. How do I change this? I've searched for an answer. The only likely solutions suggest removing the "other bookmarks" folder, but the description of how to do that doesn't work. Nowhere can I find a "remove other bookmarks" option. And the delete option is greyed out.

I don't necessarily need to hide or remove it, as long as I can get the bookmarks manager/Library to open at the top, ie. "Bookmarks Menu".

Cheers, Ian
creator: IanStar

title: Snap Firefox 122.0-2.1 introduces weird behavior of tabulator in text boxes (Ubuntu 23.10)
content:
Hi all,

Some weeks ago I noticed weird behavior in Firefox with regards to the tabulator key. When I pressed tabulator, it inserted an actual tabulator instead of interacting with the website/text box (either by leaving the text box and going to the next field in the website, or by nesting any un/ordered list, whenever the functionality is given by the website).

I have confirmed that this behavior was introduced in snap Firefox 122.0-2.1, since I tried reverting to Firefox 122.0-2, which was in the snap cache, and I was unable to reproduce the issue, neither in safe nor in normal mode. In Firefox 122.0-2.1 I can reproduce this in both modes. I'm running Ubuntu 23.10.

As a form of proof, please see this text, which is created by substituting space strokes by tab strokes in Firefox 122.0-2.1 (safe mode).

If I can provide any more feedback, please let me know.
creator: Icemole

title: Seperate accounts with different emails, work and home mixed up
content: I thought I had two different accounts. Home, with my personal email and work, with my work email. My work computer crashed a few months ago, and out IT department was able to recover all my bookmarks, but it wasn't easy, so I was told. I decided to do what I do at home and that was to create an account for work, which I did. I now have an account for home with it's own bookmarks, and email, and a work account with it's own bookmarks and totally different email. I recently got a work phone. In the process of setting it up I synced it up with my work account. when I came home tonight I got online and all my work bookmarks were on my home computer. How did this happen? Now I don't have my home bookmarks. I tried signing out and signing back in with my home account, but no luck. This is very frustrating especially since they are two totally different accounts. SO, how do I get my home bookmarks back on my home computer? Thanks
creator: ghaskin

title: Yahoo mail is either loading very slow or not at all, expericeing the same with other web pages?
content: Yahoo mail is either loading very slow or not at all, experiencing the same with other web pages? Have cleared cookies/cache. Yahoo mail works fine on my other non-firefox systems.
creator: BRENTBDV

title: Magnify
content: Firefox has a magnifier in the url bar. It activates for no reason. The arrow pointer does not move but the magnifier keeps going up and down 110%- 145%- 38% all over the place. only hitting escape several times and then touching the magnifier resets it back to 100% {normal} is there a way of eliminating this feature alltogether? Any help would be appreciated.
creator: cqng54a

title: The W10 taskbar will not come up when Firefox in fullscreen.
content:
One of the recent updates to Firefox now has the Win10 taskbar unavailable while Firefox is in fullscreen mode. It should appear when I mouse to the bottom of the screen. I see other complaints about this opened and closed for up to 6 years. No actual answers, just workarounds. Hitting F11 twice solves it temporarily, but it comes back. No, it's not Windows. No other software on my laptop does this. Yes, I keep Firefox updated.

Any progress? THX
creator: professor59

title: Turn off translator popup but keep option to translate
content: I turned off the translator popup via about:config and browser.translations.automaticallyPopup to false. Now translation is gone. How can I keep the option to quickly translate a page in the address bar without having the popup jump in my face each time I open a new tab, forcing me to click it to make it go away? This would be a nice option but an extremely distracting presentation. thanks.
creator: nopinkdragons
